avdta.network

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.Network
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Simulator

    public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    A Network contains the Nodes and Links that vehicles would pass through during simulation. It also contains methods for controlling or accessing the dynamic network loading, such as shortest path. The Network does not itself contain or simulate vehicles. See Simulator.

    • Method Detail

      • getHVsUseReservations

        public static boolean getHVsUseReservations()
        Returns whether human-driven vehicles can use reservations. If so, they are required to reserve all possible turning movements. If not, they will attempt to avoid reservations during path finding. Even if this returns false, human-driven vehicles can still be forced to use reservations due to lack of connectivity.
        Returns:
        whether human-driven vehicles can use reservations

      • setNodes

        public void setNodes(java.util.Set<Node> nodes)
        Updates the Nodes of this network. All Nodes in the set are initialized (see Node.initialize()).
        Parameters:
        nodes - the new set of Nodes

      • getTT

        public double getTT(java.util.Collection<Link> links,
                    int time)
        Returns the total travel time for all links in the specified set.
        Parameters:
        links - the set of links to analyze
        time - the analysis time (s)
        Returns:
        the total travel time (s)

      • getLinks

        public java.util.Set<Link> getLinks()
        Returns the set of Links
        Returns:
        the set of Links

      • setHVsUseReservations

        public void setHVsUseReservations(boolean h)
        Updates whether human-driven vehicles can use reservations. If so, they are required to reserve all possible turning movements. If not, they will attempt to avoid reservations during path finding. Even if this is false, human-driven vehicles can still be forced to use reservations due to lack of connectivity. This is initially set to false.
        Parameters:
        h - whether human-driven vehicles can use reservations

      • setLinks

        public void setLinks(java.util.Set<Link> links)
        Updates the set of Links. All Links in the set are initialized (see Link.initialize()). In addition, dynamic transit lanes (SharedTransitCTMLink) are tied with their TransitLane counterparts (see SharedTransitCTMLink.tieCells()).
        Parameters:
        links - the new set of Links

      • setNetwork

        public void setNetwork(java.util.Set<Node> nodes,
                       java.util.Set<Link> links)
        Updates both the set of Nodes and the set of Links.
        Parameters:
        nodes - the new set of Nodes
        links - the new set of Links
        See Also:
        setNodes(java.util.Set), setLinks(java.util.Set)

      • setUseLinkDijkstras

        public void setUseLinkDijkstras(boolean l)
        Sets whether to use Dijkstra's on the dual graph. This increases computation time, but is the correct method to use in networks containing intersections with limited turning movements. If all intersections do not limit turning movements (such as with reservations or stop signs), this can be set to false. This is initially set to true.
        Parameters:
        l - whether to use Dijkstra's on the dual graph

        Returns:
        the set of Nodes

      • getNode

        public Node getNode(int id)
        Searches for the Node with the given id. Note that this is O(n). If many searches are desired, creating a mapping of ids to Nodes is faster (see createNodeIdsMap()).
        Parameters:
        id - the id to search for
        Returns:
        the Node with the given id, or null if not found

      • getLink

        public Link getLink(int id)
        Searches for the Link with the given id. Note that this is O(n). If many searches are desired, creating a mapping of ids to Links is faster (see createLinkIdsMap()).
        Parameters:
        id - the id to search for
        Returns:
        the Link with the given id, or null if not found

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(Node o,
                     Node d)
        Finds the shortest path between the given origin and destination. This method calls dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost) and traces the shortest path.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        Returns:
        the shortest path.

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(Node o,
                     Node d,
                     int dep_time,
                     double vot,
                     DriverType driver,
                     TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds the shortest path between the given origin and destination with the specified departure time, value of time, driver, and cost function. This method calls dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost) and traces the shortest path.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        Returns:
        the shortest path.
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • dijkstras

        public void dijkstras(Node o,
                      int dep_time,
                      double vot,
                      DriverType driver,
                      TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds the one-to-all shortest paths with the specified parameters. This calls dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost, boolean). Use trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) to get the shortest path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • dijkstras

        public void dijkstras(Node o,
                      int dep_time,
                      double vot,
                      DriverType driver,
                      TravelCost costFunc,
                      boolean link_dijkstras)
        Finds the one-to-all shortest paths with the specified parameters. This calls dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost, boolean). Use node_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) or link_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) to get the shortest path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        link_dijkstras - whether to find shortest path on the dual graph
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • link_dijkstras

        public void link_dijkstras(Node o,
                           int dep_time,
                           double vot,
                           DriverType driver,
                           TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds one-to-all shortest paths on the dual graph. Vehicles may start on any outgoing link from the specified origin. Use link_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) to get the shortest path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • dijkstras

        public void dijkstras(Link starting,
                      int dep_time,
                      double vot,
                      DriverType driver,
                      TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds one-to-all shortest paths on the dual graph. Vehicles must start on the specified link. The origin is the upstream node of the specified Link (Link.getSource()). Use link_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) to get the shortest path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        starting - the origin Link
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • node_dijkstras

        public void node_dijkstras(Node o,
                           int dep_time,
                           double vot,
                           DriverType driver,
                           TravelCost costFunc)
        Finds one-to-all shortest paths. Use node_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) to get the shortest path between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        dep_time - the departure time (s)
        vot - the value of time ($/hr)
        driver - indicates whether the driver is human or autonomous, and whether it is transit
        costFunc - the cost function used for link travel costs
        See Also:
        DriverType, TravelCost

      • trace

        public Path trace(Node o,
                  Node d)
        Returns the shortest path between the two specified nodes. Call this after calling dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost). Calls node_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) or link_trace(avdta.network.node.Node, avdta.network.node.Node) depending on setUseLinkDijkstras(boolean).
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        Returns:
        the shortest path between the two nodes, or null if no path was found

      • node_trace

        public Path node_trace(Node o,
                       Node d)
        Returns the shortest path between the two specified nodes. Call this after calling node_dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost).
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        Returns:
        the shortest path between the two nodes, or null if no path was found

      • link_trace

        public Path link_trace(Node o,
                       Node d)
        Returns the shortest path between the two specified nodes. Call this after calling link_dijkstras(avdta.network.node.Node, int, double, avdta.vehicle.DriverType, avdta.network.cost.TravelCost).
        Parameters:
        o - the origin
        d - the destination
        Returns:
        the shortest path between the two nodes, or null if no path was found

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the network. This should be called before simulating. This calls Node.initialize() and Link.initialize() for all Nodes and Links. In addition, dynamic transit lanes (SharedTransitCTMLink) are tied with their TransitLane counterparts (see SharedTransitCTMLink.tieCells()). Also, dynamic lane reversal links (DLRCTMLink) are tied (see tieLinks()) if dynamic lane reversal is enabled.

      • setDLR

        public static void setDLR(boolean d)
        Sets whether dynamic lane reversal is enabled. This is false by default. Dynamic lane reversal only occurs on dynamic lane reversal links (DLRCTMLink).
        Parameters:
        d - whether DLR is enabled

      • isDLR

        public static boolean isDLR()
        Returns whether dynamic lane reversal is enabled. This is false by default. Dynamic lane reversal only occurs on dynamic lane reversal links (DLRCTMLink).
        Returns:
        whether dynamic lane reversal is enabled

      • tieLinks

        public void tieLinks()
        This ties links for dynamic lane reversal.
        See Also:
        DLRCTMLink, DLRCTMLink.tieCells(avdta.network.link.DLRCTMLink)

      • save

        public void save(Project project)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This saves the network data to the specified Project. This includes saving nodes, links, link coordinates, and signal data. Note that data will be overwritten. Also, signal data is saved only for intersections with a Signalized.
        Parameters:
        project - the Project to save to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed
        See Also:
        Signalized

      • createLinkIdsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Link> createLinkIdsMap()
        Creates a mapping of ids to Links.
        Returns:
        a mapping of ids to Links

      • createNodeIdsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Node> createNodeIdsMap()
        Creates a mapping of ids to Nodes.
        Returns:
        a mapping of ids to Nodes

        public double transit_trace(Node origin,
                            Node dest)

      • transit_dijkstras

        public void transit_dijkstras(Node o,
                              int dep_time)
